fields.description:
When adding git repository to FishEye, the rename detection defaults are different depending whether advance settings was shown or not.
In simple case when one follows wizard and doesn't show advanced settings, the rename detection would be set to 'None'.
In other case, when one clicks show advanced settings in the add repository wizard, the copy option is displayed by default so this value would be saved unless one changes that.

Also, the values shown:
 * none
 * copies
 * moves 
 * detailed
are not clear - copies should be renamed to "copies and moves" as basically this is what git log -C option does.
fields.summary: Use 'copies' as the default option for git rename detection

fields.description:
The tabs in the [Admin Repositories|http://localhost:8060/admin/admin.do#repositories] fail to work in Chrome on OS X Mavericks.

Clicking on the *Stash repositories* or *Plugins* tabs does not transition to the correct content. The URL will change, but the content does not. For example, URL changes from {{http://localhost:8060/admin/admin.do#repositories}} to {{http://localhost:8060/admin/admin.do#repositories-stash}}, but the page content still shows information from the *Native repository access*.

Safari (7.0.4 (9537.76.4) and Firefox (29.0.1) function correctly.

*Version information*

FishEye 3.4.4 Build:20140520040848 2014-05-20
Chrome 35.0.1916.114
OS X 10.9.3

*Workaround*

I've found that resizing the screen will cause the content on the page to change.
Alternatively you can use Firefox or Safari until a fix is implemented.
fields.summary: Admin Repository Tabs Don't Function with Chrome 35 on OS X 10.9.3

fields.description:
Our developers currently wants to make the title in review creation mandatory. Currently it is easy to forget to fill in the title post creation.

By forcing developers to think of meaningful titles, reviews objectives are easier to understand versus blank titles.

Repository paused due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.SvnDiffParsingException: Unexpected line in overall diff at 1 com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.SvnDiffParsingException: Unexpected line in overall diff at 1

fields.description:
Currently the installer for Windows created a FISHEYE_INST, but it doesn't check for old data.

The suggestion would be to allow the user to specify the location of the old instance, in order to allow the installer to take its data and move it manually to the new FISHEYE_INST created.

I'm not suggesting to detect if FISHEYE_INST is set or not because the customer might have FishEye running as a service, and in this case there is no environment variable to define FISHEYE_INST, as it is defined in the wrapper.conf.
fields.summary: FishEye installer for Windows could detect if the customer doesn't have a FISHEYE_INST and move the data manually from the old install directory

fields.description:
If a system does not have git installed or git is not on the path, then the user will still be able to proceed through the add repo wizard.  No error will occur until the user has finished the wizard, at which point this message will be presented:
{noformat}
Error
Failed to start new repository fff: Problem loading repository 'fff' - Unable to get git version.
{noformat}

The repository will then be created in a stopped state, but the user is thrown back to the first step of the wizard.

We should block the creation of git repositories if we cannot get the git version.
fields.summary: Ugly failure mode when Git is not installed or is not available on the path of a system

fields.description:
A FishEye instance with more then 5 repositories added to it, have 5 repositories in Running state. The other repository can't be started when any of the existing repository is stopped. When trying to start the other repository results in the error being thrown as attached in the screenshot.

Prerequisite:-
A FishEye instance using Starter License with more than 5 repositories added to it.

Steps to reproduce:-
# Ensure that 5 repositories are running in FishEye.
# Stop any of the existing running repository.
# Try to start the other repository that is in Stopped state.

Note:-
Restarting the FishEye instance allows the repository to be started. The same repository that was stopped can be started back.
fields.summary: Unable To Switch Repository In Starter License

fields.description:

We need to handle this without sending multiple notifications for watches.

I believe that was the spirit of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-3920.
fields.summary: Ability to redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS

fields.description:
During the install with the FishEye installer for Windows, the suggestion is to add a note in the screen where the user chooses "Default" or Custom" install.

The note would indicate that, if the user had FishEye previously running as a service using the wrapper, he should choose "Custom install" in order to manually select the data location, as the data directory is defined within the wrapper and there is actually no FISHEYE_INST being used.

For reference, see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+upgrade+guide], Method 4, *Using a FISHEYE_INST directory and/or previously running as a Windows Service using the wrapper*
fields.summary: Add note in the FishEye installer for Windows

fields.description:
Currently, if the customer already has a FISHEYE_INST set and choose "Default Install", FishEye creates a new data directory and overrides the existing environment variable. 

The installer should be able to identify if a FISHEYE_INST is already being used and let it set as it is if using Default Install and, if using Custom Install, it should fill the "browse" field already with the current FISHEYE_INST directory.

For reference, see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+upgrade+guide
fields.summary: FishEye installer for Windows should identify if there is already a FISHEYE_INST

fields.description:
Under some circumstances which are not known, 'git whatchanged' will fail to include commits.  When this happens, FishEye will warn and attempt to proceed with indexing anyway.

We should fix this so that when one of these commits is encountered, FishEye stops processing the whatchanged output, indexes the missing commit as a single commit, and then proceeds with indexing.  This will be a bit tricky to ensure that things happen in the correct order.

See linked support case for more details
fields.summary: git whatchanged has been shown to skip commits in some circumstances

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
If you have added project content with a path name that contains spaces in FishEye (*Administration > Projects > <PROJECT-NAME> > FishEye Content*), you will not be remove it via the UI, pressing the remove button will refresh the page, but the action is never actually performed.

Debug logs show the call properly executed:
{noformat}
2014-05-09 14:04:10,046 DEBUG [qtp889559500-177 ] fisheye ProfilingServletFilter-logRequest - start request POST /fisheye/admin/addPathToFisheyeProject.do?id=1&atl_token=5f5f8ca96a0b0707ac0df69e930e86b37b33f1fe&
path=some%20new%20directory&_FALSE_.wholeRep=false&rep=localgit sessionid=qy0lpkmxl5ru1qnau4exe2uy4

...

2014-05-09 14:04:10,147 DEBUG [qtp889559500-177 ] fisheye ProfilingServletFilter-logRequest - end request in 101ms POST /fisheye/admin/addPathToFisheyeProject.do?id=1&atl_token=5f5f8ca96a0b0707ac0df69e930e86b37b33f1fe&path=some%20new%20directory&_FALSE_.wholeRep=false&rep=localgit sessionid=qy0lpkmxl5ru1qnau4exe2uy4 200
{noformat}

*Workaround*
(!) *The workaround should only be used at your own risk and should be first tested on a test environment. When performing in production make sure to create a full offline database backup first*
# Shut down FishEye/Crucible
# Create a full database backup
# Locate the path with the space in its name in the {{cru_content_root}} table and delete the row
# Start FishEye/Crucible
fields.summary: Cannot remove project content if path contain spaces

fields.description:
Currently, once the scanning phase is complete, Fisheye will commence counting Lines Of Code (LOC).  It will continue to count them until it finishes, without executing another scanning phase.

This can be a problem if there is a lot of LOC data - it can take potentially 20 days to scan LOC for a large repo.  During this time scanning is blocked and reviews can't be done on new changes.

To fix this, we need to ensure that LOC counting can be safely paused and resumed, and then apply a timeout to terminate it if it is taking too long.  Once LOC counting has been terminated, another scan can be performed and then LOC counting can be resumed.
fields.summary: LOC counting should time out and save work done if it takes too long

My suggestion is to change these messages to something different, as users actually see these messages in the dashboard when they are not logged in.

Related JAC asking for the change in the documentation: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5188
fields.summary: Change message at Front Page Customization

fields.description:
Currently the page https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Customizing+the+front+page is not very clear about what it does.

1) It does not contain examples of what the user will see after setting the option, and it might appear that this is actually changing the Login page and not the Dashboard, so my first suggestion is to add examples by the end of the page.

2) It says {{You can customize the welcome message and the support contact information for your organization that users see when they first log in}}. For me it seems they will see the message after logging in, but actually the message is showed in the Dashboard only if the user is not logged in.

3) As per my first point, some users come to this page expecting to change the Login page. Maybe a yellow block can be included in this page saying that "If users are intended to customise the Login page, please take a look at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Customising+FishEye%27s+look+and+feel]".

Related JAC asking for the change in the application: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5189
fields.summary: Document change: Customizing the front page

git diff command can quote one file name and leave another unquoted in its output in the {{diff --git}} line, see:
{noformat}
$ git diff -C --no-abbrev --full-index -U0 b17f20aeb10f00d9b8c485b996d56470ebbc0948..ae1e8091e1ef8deab29731ebd4f7ba4ec0a536f3
diff --git a/someFile.txt "b/anotherFile\n\r\t.txt"
similarity index 100%
rename from someFile.txt
rename to "anotherFile\n\r\t.txt"
{noformat}
on the https://bitbucket.org/pswiecicki/fe-5176-git-copy-detection-non-ascii-filenames git repository.  Apparently GitDiffParser can't cope with it and throws StringIndexOutOfBoundException in such case.

Workaround: switch off git rename detection for affected repository, i.e. change it to {{none}} and restart the repository.
fields.summary: git rename detection breaks on files with non ASCII characters in their names

Something like the following attachment could go a long way.

fields.description:
I have repository [^repo.tgz] and I'm unable to see files for tag 1.6 but I can see files for tags 1.1 - 1.5 - [^Selection_033.png].

Repository has following SVN Symbolic Rules
{code}
<symbolic auto-rules="false">
	<trunk regex="trunk(/|$) " name="trunk" logical=""/>
	<branch regex="branches/([^/]+)" name="${1}" logical=""/>
	<tag regex="tags/([^/]+)/([^/]+)" name="${1}-${2}" logical=""/>
</symbolic>
{code}

Tag 1.6 was created using full repository url ie.:
{code}
svn cp REPO_URL/branches/dev/platform/software/tool REPO_URL/tags/tool/1.6 -m "tag 1.6"
{code}

Tag 1.5 was created thru working copy ie. in working copy
{code}
svn cp branches/dev/platform/software/tool tags/tool/X
svn commit -m "tool tag 1.5"
{code}

There is a difference in {{svn log -v}} output for tag commits:
{code}
czawadka@czawadka:~/Downloads/dos/fsh14047/wc$ svn log -v -r11:12
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r11 | czawadka | 2014-04-22 09:00:42 +0200 (wto, 22 kwi 2014) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /tags/tool/1.5 (from /branches/dev/platform/software/tool:4)
   R /tags/tool/1.5/changelog.txt (from /branches/dev/platform/software/tool/changelog.txt:6)

tool tag 1.5
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r12 | czawadka | 2014-04-22 10:51:35 +0200 (wto, 22 kwi 2014) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /tags/tool/1.6 (from /branches/dev/platform/software/tool:11)

tag 1.6
------------------------------------------------------------------------
{code}

Commit r12 (tag 1.6) doesn't contain {{changelog.txt}} in its output.
fields.summary: No files in SVN tag

fields.description:
Like other Atlassian applications (CWD-422 JRA-23245 CONF-8867), FishEye does not currently support LDAP failover for authentication purposes.  Please add it.

Apparently, this might be as easy as documenting Oracle JRE's existing support for failover -- http://docs.oracle.com/javase/jndi/tutorial/ldap/misc/url.html mentions that

bq. Instead of just one URL, you can also supply a space-separated list of URLs. In this case, the LDAP provider will attempt to use each URL in turn until it is able to create a successful connection. The LDAP provider will then set the Context.PROVIDER_URL property to the successful URL, so that the application can determine which URL is being used.

(discovered in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/285282/include-2-ldap-server-addresses-into-fisheye-s-config-xml-file)
fields.summary: Failover Support For LDAP

fields.description:
Love the new feature of having a native plugin that can take the place of my homegrown one. 

The one feature it is missing, is i need to be able to prefix the project key to the git repo name. We have a few thousand repos in stash and unfortunately i think there are duplicate names.. 

i would love to see a simple textfield that new project key, repo name, and then would create the repo name based on filling in the keys plus what ever else text..

for example..

template: $projectKey-$repoSlug-git


project: IS (key = is)
repo: com.company.myrepo

fisheye repo name: is-com.company.myrepo-git
fields.summary: Add name template for Fisheye/Stash Integration new in 3.4

real    4m3.358s
user    1m54.759s
sys     0m52.803s
{code}

but the same command using jsvn has been running for over 1h still without success.

Eventually Fisheye using SVNKit fails with
{code}
2014-04-14 11:15:21,785 ERROR - Problem processing revisions from repo X due to class com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException - org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E135003: Unable to make name for '/data/atlas
sian/fisheye/data/var/tmp/svn'

        at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2Infill2Processor$1.perform(Svn2Infill2Processor.java:113)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.cache.BaseRevisionCache.withDbWriteLock(BaseRevisionCache.java:1014)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2Infill2Processor.process(Svn2Infill2Processor.java:113)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2Scanner.slurpRepository(Svn2Scanner.java:210)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2Scanner.doSlurpTransaction(Svn2Scanner.java:179)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.ping(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:75)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(BaseRepositoryEngine.java:86)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryEngine.slurp(RepositoryEngine.java:397)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.IndexingPingRequest.doRequest(IndexingPingRequest.java:25)

        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.access$100(RepositoryHandle.java:56)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle$2.run(RepositoryHandle.java:175)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Caused by: org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E135003: Unable to make name for '/data/atlassian/fisheye/data/var/tmp/svn'
        at org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException.fromException(ClientException.java:68)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl17.SVNClientImpl.getClientException(SVNClientImpl.java:1294)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.javahl17.SVNClientImpl.diff(SVNClientImpl.java:1008)
        at org.apache.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.diff(SVNClient.java:182)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient$3.call(SvnThrottledClient.java:205)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient$3.call(SvnThrottledClient.java:202)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnTask.run(SvnTask.java:34)
        ... 3 more
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E135003: Unable to make name for '/data/atlassian/fisheye/data/var/tmp/svn'
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:64)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNFileUtil.createUniqueFile(SVNFileUtil.java:544)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc2.ng.SvnNgRemoteDiffEditor2.applyTextDelta(SvnNgRemoteDiffEditor2.java:315)
{code}
which suggests the SVNKit failed to create temporary file after 99999 tries.

There are two problems: 
* svnkit should use much less expensive way to find unique file 
* tmp files are not removed from tmp folder

h3. Workaround 0
Use native SVN client as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Native+Subversion+Client

h3. Workaround 1
Stop Fisheye, remove FISHEYE_INST/var/tmp/svn folder and start Fisheye again - https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/279448/deleting-fisheye-temporary-files

h3. Workaround 2
another workaround is to change the URL from file:// to be remote URL (eg: HTTP) to index the problematic changeset and switch back to file:// protocol later on
fields.summary: svnkit file:// performance degredation due to tmp files

fields.description:
On admin / repositories page when I see any repo with a name with 2 subsequent dots hitting refresh causes error:
{noformat}
Error calling server:com.google.gwt.event.shared.UmbrellaException: Exception caught: (Error) stack: Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: #arrow-test.piotr..test-menu at Function.Sizzle.error (https://fisheye.dev.internal.atlassian.com/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/SNAPSHOT/1/c49422d6510aec81ee87f72b352d479b/_/download/contextbatch2/js/atl.admin,atl.general/batch.js:22:15844) at tokenize 
...
{noformat}

After closing the error screen, possibly not all the repositories will be listed and the repository administration screen is effectively inaccessible.

*Workaround*
The repository management screen can still be accessed using the repository handle in the URL. The URL format for the repository administration reads as: {{<SITE-URL>/admin/admin.do#repositories-view-<REPOSITORY-HANDLE>}}. Thus if you replace the repository handle (following the above example it would be {{test.piotr..test}}), then the admin screen shows up for the repository in question and all operations can be performed. Although the overview screen will remain problematic.
fields.summary: repositories with dots in name breaks admin page

fields.description:
h4. How it is working right now

If I have a project called Angry Nerds with "ANGRY" as key, any commit message that has the word "Angry" will be brought up in the source tab for the project, even though there is no connection between them other then the word.

An example screenshot can be seen [here| https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729532/fisheye.png?version=2&modificationDate=1376304153908&api=v2]

h5. Workaround

As a workaround you can set an entity link between the JIRA project and Fisheye repository/repositories, the project screen will only show commits from those projects then, this will allow content to be restricted to only 'approved' repositories. Please see the following document for more information on how to setup entity links;

- [Creating Links Between Projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Creating+Links+Between+Projects]
fields.summary: FishEye commit comments that mention project's key appear on project's source tab

fields.description:
FishEye doesn't work properly if there are repositories with similar names, being a dash the difference. Besides showing the wrong name for the repository, using FishEye's Quick Search throws an exception. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create two repositories, one named {{abc}} and another named {{ab-c}}. In my case, both repositories are shown as {{ab-c}}, and also Stopping/Starting one of the repositories also Stops/Starts the other.
# Try to perform a Quick Search for any term. It throws a {{javax.el.ELException - java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Can't associate repository ab-c with entityId abc}}.

Log attached.
fields.summary: Dash in the repository name breaks FishEye's search

fields.description:
When a git repo is being slurped by FishEye, and it has no tags yet, FishEye logs the following at INFO:

{code}
2014-04-08 01:21:58,387 DEBUG [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [STASH-audit-plugin]: Processing tags
2014-04-08 01:21:58,387 DEBUG [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye LoggingProcessMonitor-onBeforeStart - Starting process: /usr/bin/git show-ref -d --tags
2014-04-08 01:21:58,493 DEBUG [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye LoggingProcessMonitor-onAfterFinished - Finished process: /usr/bin/git show-ref -d --tags took 106ms
2014-04-08 01:21:58,493 INFO  [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye LoggingProcessMonitor-onAfterFinished - Exception executing command "/usr/bin/git show-ref -d --tags" Non-zero exit code: 1
2014-04-08 01:21:58,494 DEBUG [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [STASH-audit-plugin]: Finished processing tags
2014-04-08 01:21:58,494 DEBUG [IncrPing1 STASH-audit-plugin ] fisheye Timer-output - <- slurp of STASH-audit-plugin  time 212 millis mem_usage = 624641320 heapsize = 2141061120 freemem = 1516419800

{code}

Indeed - that repo has no tags.
And - git handles this by exiting with exit code 1.

{code}
STASH-audit-plugin/clone$ /usr/bin/git show-ref -d --tags
STASH-audit-plugin/clone$ echo $?
1
{code}

Can we stop the git client from throwing an exception for this git operation, since having no tags is quite common, and the message that there was an exception could be disconcerting to some users.
fields.summary: Better handling slurping a git repo, which has no tags.
Exception executing command "/usr/bin/git show-ref -d --tags" Non-zero exit code: 1

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+anonymous+access

Address this paragraph:
{quote}
Anonymous access to FishEye is allowed by default. You can disable anonymous access at the following levels:

-     Globally by turning off 'Global Anonymous Access' on the Administration, Authentication page. When this setting is off, an anonymous user just sees a log in page. When it is on they see an activity stream of all repositories which are visible to anonymous users.
-     For all repositories which are using the default Security settings (using the Repository defaults),
-    or for particular repositories.{quote}
fields.summary: FE-5134 Disable "Global Anonymous Access" - update docs to reflect this change

fields.description: When using smart reviews the first commit will create a review using +review CR-PROJECT-NAME. Further commits adding content to this newly created review do need the corresponding review-id. But to do so, it is required to push the first commit, otherwise the review does not exist yet thus no id is available, which is problematic since sometimes pushing the first commit is no option. A workaround is to manually create a review via the webinterface but this is not a perfect solution at all.
fields.summary: Cannot refer to review using smart-reviews

fields.description:
The HTTP connector has been configured with proxy info so it is not possible to access the server without going through proxy server.

It would be better to have another HTTP connector without proxy info so that it can be used for the integration with JIRA server.
fields.summary: Support multiple HTTP connector

fields.description:
Add LDAP timeouts so that any problems talking with the LDAP server fail in a timely manner. 

Add pooling for SSL based LDAP connections:

See

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/jndi/newstuff/readtimeout.html

and

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Performance+Problem+when+Using+LDAPS

for background.
fields.summary: Add LDAP timeouts and default to pooling SSL connections

fields.description:
Just bringing this up again.  If FE-18 is anything to go by, this has been a long-requested feature since nearly the beginning of ticket-time.

It's been discussed plenty in many (I counted at least a half-dozen) tickets, under Crucible or Fisheye.  So I won't go in to this again.

But I just wanted to put this on developers' radars again.  One can always hope.  Maybe in time for 4.0?

Thanks,
PH
PS
Call this New Feature, or Improvement, or even an Epic, or merely a Task.   Regardless, of the Issue Type, I do hope it gets addressed.

fields.summary: OAuth application link requests might fail to be verified if AJP or Crowd SSO authentication is enabled

fields.description:
Google's source tree is managed via multiple git project using a tool called repo. More information about it can be found here: http://source.android.com/source/downloading.html

It would be desirable for FishEye to support this, whereas there are multiple git repositories and make them searchable as if it is one single git repository (in reality there are multiple git repositories). FishEye should be able to index all repositories in one manifest as one single repository and provide all the features accordingly.
fields.summary: Support Google's repo

fields.description:
When sharing a changeset and filling in some text in the "Add an optional note" field, the email generated does not include the note. The following email was generated after I shared a changeset including a note:

{quote}Chris Butler shared a repository  with you:

CMS: https://git.zedcore.com:8443/changelog/CMS?cs=3440c182bfb5bd0fd3171c064a5368c5a9750b9b{quote}

The email also says "shared a repository" when I actually shared a changeset, which is slightly confusing.
fields.summary: Sharing a changeset with a note: email does not include the note
